column5: Just wondering if rice lake has a fishable population of muskies? I'm not looking for anybody's spots, just want to know if I should take musky gear with me or if I should just stick to bass fishing in the summer? Thanks. You can PM me if you want. Thanks and have a great day!
there was a post about them in the otonabee a few months back, not sure if anyone has the link...
Just follow me on a tourney,cant seem to get rid of them
Yep, don't waste your time with bass when you can catch musky and eyes all day!!  S.
Nice ones in rice. My pb is from rice.
lol ive tried fishing Rice for musky numerous times with zero luck. the only musky I catch are accidental while bass fishing. would love to hear some tips on where to catch em..
Definitely worth bringing your muskie tackle to any of the Kawartha Lakes, especially the larger lakes.
I've caught them on jerk, lipless, and dead sticking senko's. They love JDM jerkbaits! HaHa!
Right on there, unless your catchin big Smallies on a flyrod, off main lake points, otherwise its Muskies and Walleyes all the way, with flies too
